Social Media Specialist Job at El-Shaddai Covenant Ministries




        
    

        
        El-Shaddai Covenant Ministries is a Christ-centred community built on love, faith, and fellowship, dedicated to building a people of power, purpose, purity, and passion for Jesus Christ. Our purpose is to "build lives together" by responding to God, reaching people, reinforcing relationships, raising leaders, and realizing destinies.

This involves ministering salvation, adopting people into God's family, developing healthy relationships, training converts to spiritual maturity, and empowering believers to fulfill their God-given potential.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Specialist
     

            
    



Job Location: Abule Egba, Lagos
Employment Type: Part-time (On-Site)

Position Overview


	We are seeking a creative and passionate Social Media Specialist to lead our church’s online presence.
	This role is perfect for a storyteller at heart—someone who loves to design, write, and share content that inspires, encourages and engages.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and manage a consistent social media content calendar.
	Create inspiring and visually engaging posts, reels, stories, and videos for platforms like Instagram, Facebook, YouTube and TikTok.
	Capture and share moments from worship services, ministries and community events.
	Write thoughtful captions that connect people with scriptures, sermons and church life.
	Foster engagement by responding to comments, messages, and interactions in a warm and Christ-centered way.
	Stay updated on creative trends in social media and adapt them for ministry purposes.


Qualifications


	Candidates should possess an OND with 2+ years of experience in content creation, social media management or digital storytelling.
	Personal relationship with Jesus Christ.
	Proficiency with social media platforms, analytics and digital marketing tools.
	Proficiency in tools such as Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar design/video apps.
	Strong writing skills, eye for photography, videography and visual storytelling.
	Highly organized, self-motivated, and detail-oriented.


Added Advantage:


	Experience managing social media for a church, non-profit or ministry.
	Familiarity with live streaming and church-specific digital media practices.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resumes and Portfolio to: toyintiti.a@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Account Officer Job at NIPCO Gas Limited




        
    

        
        NIPCO Gas Limited is a 100% subsidiary of NIPCO Plc, a foremost downstream oil company,which is one of the largest downstream fuel distribution and marketing companies in Nigeria.NIPCO Gas in partnership with the NNPC Gas Marketing Limited (NGML) is distributing and supplying Natural Gas to various Industrial & Commercial customers in Ogun State, Edo State and Abuja FCT and in process of expansion of gas distribution network to Oyo State & Lagos State. NIPCO Gas has a very robust infrastructure of Gas Distribution and caters to customer’s energy need across 22 states and FCT Abuja in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer
     

            
    



Job Location: Apapa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate and organized financial records, including journal entries, ledgers, and accounts receivable/payable.
	Reconcile financial transactions, accounts, and discrepancies to ensure accuracy and integrity of financial data.
	Assist with month-end and year-end closing processes, including reconciliations, adjustments, and accruals.
	Prepare and process invoices, payments, expense reports, and other financial transactions.
	Monitor and track financial transactions, expenses, and budgets to ensure compliance with regulations and company policies.
	Support the management with budget monitoring and cost control
	Track account payables and receivables


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a minimum BSc/HND in Accounting with 3 - 4 years of Accounting work experience;
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and basic accounting software;
	Strong numerical and analytical skill
	Attention to detail and accuracy
	Good communication and organizational skills
	Ability to work with minimal supervision.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: info@nipcogas.com using the Job Position applied for as the subject of the mail.

  "title": "HR / Admin Officer",
  "description": "Transparency Scape Insurance Brokers is&nbsp;recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;HR / Admin Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Anthony, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Strategic HR and Operations Leadership:


	Align HR &amp; Operational Strategies with Business Goals: Ensure all HR and Admin initiatives are aligned with the company&rsquo;s vision, mission, and long-term objectives.
	Process &amp; SOP Development: Design, document, and refine standard operating procedures (SOPs) across HR and operational functions.
	Policy Implementation &amp; Compliance: Lead the formulation, communication, and enforcement of company policies in line with labor laws and regulatory standards.
	Workforce Planning &amp; Organizational Structuring: Oversee talent mapping, headcount planning, and succession strategies to ensure business continuity.
	Strategic HR Advisory: Act as a strategic advisor to management on people-related matters.


Operational Oversight &amp; Excellence:


	Office &amp; Facilities Management: Supervise the smooth running of daily operations, ensuring that infrastructure and workspaces meet functional and safety requirements.
